title: What is the absolute value of -10? - Quora

response.answer_text: The absolute value ( | | ) of a real number x is its distance (unsigned) from zero on the number line and is defined as follows: | x | = x if x ≥ 0 (Example: | 5 | = 5, i.e., 5 is a distance of 5 units from zero) | x | = -x if x < 0 (Example: | -5 | = -(-5) = 5, i.e., -5 is a distance of 5 units from zero) Therefore, the absolute value of -10 = |-10 | = -(-10) = 10 This result tells us that -10 is a distance of 10 units from zero on the number line.
Absolute value refers to the distance from 0 and the distance can never be negative so Absolute value of -10=|-10|=10
